Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided information, it is not directly mentioned which specific sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented by Rob Sinclair or any organizations he has worked with. However, it is evident from his beliefs and experiences that he emphasizes the importance of considering economic, human, and natural capital while working collaboratively towards sustainability and creating a positive culture within organizations. These principles suggest a focus on long-term success and minimizing negative impacts on the environment and society. While it may not be directly related to implementing specific sustainable or environmental practices, these broader perspectives are essential components of achieving sustainability goals.

Brand process which delivers an operable framework for brand building that nurtures purpose meaningful connection values-led leadership and positive culture It focusses on empowerment strategies rather than fear based or extrinsic strategies for brands and communications Rob Sinclair believes in T Harv Eker’s maxim that “how you do anything is how you do everything” This is a guiding principle in his life Rob’s passion for business has found him at the pioneering phase of many new and exciting industries including the Internet and IT industry in Calgary self-producing a traveling internet-based vegan cooking show and becoming president and owner of an organic food manufacturing company called Friendly Foods He now uses that experience to help businesses grow and thrive by showing them the inherent value of taking their economic human and natural capital into account and working with all of those resources He believes that there can’t be sustainability without collaboration and there

for growth across each of the key areas Once an individual or team survey has been completed you will receive tips and recommendations to improve the area in which your organisation scored lowest  Re-assess to track company progress over time and receive new recommendations to enable ongoing growth  A sense of progress keeps us humans motivated and on track Come back after you’ve implemented changes and see where your organisation has improved The goal is for your organization to become more self-aware employees more engaged in the journey customers more committed and you see conscious brand growth  Return as many times as you like All of your assessment results will be stored on your profile   Keep updated with the latest news around the world on conscious branding and business Stay in the know as we release new tools insights and data

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided information, it seems that the Conscious Brands® Assessment Tool focuses primarily on organizational self-awareness and development rather than specific environmental impact metrics. However, the tool does encourage organizations to measure themselves against the "Six Pillars" of a Conscious Brand, which include Higher Purpose, Purpose-driven Strategy, Intrinsically Engaged Employees, Empathically Aligned Customers, Conscious Communications, and Agility. While these pillars encompass various aspects of responsible business practice, they may not directly address environmental impact. To better understand the environmental impact metrics reported within this tool, additional information would be necessary.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Based on the provided information, it is not explicitly stated whether the organization has made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility. However, there are hints suggesting that the organization might be moving towards becoming a conscious brand. A conscious brand focuses on creating value for the world, measuring itself against six pillars of a conscious brand, and prioritizing higher purposes over shareholder value alone. These efforts suggest that the organization may be considering its impact on society and the environment. While it cannot be confirmed if the organization has made any specific public commitments related to social or corporate responsibility, it appears that the organization is taking steps towards becoming a more socially responsible entity.

source.content: As a society our value system is changing Education levels have risen and global awareness of life options and possibilities has soared We are becoming a much more conscious society we are shifting from materialistic influences to others-centred influences and our expectations of business have changed This shift in business values is described in a Fast Company article published in April   ‘The social contract that applies to capitalism has been rewritten Creating value for Shareholders at the expense of everything else will seem radically out of touch Creating value for the world now seems the only viable things to do This is going to force investors leaders and product marketing and operations teams to reconsider what they do and how they do it and how they can be part of the epic reconstruction or risk being irrelevant’  Conscious Brands bare their soul They dare to dream how the world could be There is an element of modern life that matters to them and that they want to change They

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: The key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce involve various stakeholders such as consumers, suppliers, employees, non-profit organizations, governments, and other businesses. These partnerships aim to create shared value, foster innovation, promote sustainability, and enhance the overall impact of businesses on society and the environment. Examples of these partnerships include B Corporations (Benefit Corporations) that work towards creating a positive social and environmental impact through their business practices; supply chain initiatives that focus on ethical sourcing, fair labor practices, and environmental stewardship; and cross-sector collaborations addressing pressing societal issues like poverty, education, and climate change.

a business leader the tool enables you to invite your entire team to assess your organisation and receive a collective insight report Receive overall results as well as insights into departments and roles When employees are empowered to contribute and be heard they feel more connected and motivated to work towards your purpose and growth together  Setting up a collective assessment is easy All you need is the email addresses of those you wish to participate It could be a department a team or your entire workforce Click the link below to get started  Receive recommendations based on your results to empower your journey towards conscious growth  We’ve partnered with experts in the fields of human behaviour change management communications customer experience and leadership to develop recommendations for growth across each of the key areas Once an individual or team survey has been completed you will receive tips and recommendations to improve the area in which your organisation scored
Keep updated with the latest news around the world on conscious branding and business Stay in the know as we release new tools insights and data

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
The tool offers several benefits for employees who participate in the assessment process. Some of these benefits include:

1. Empowerment: Employees feel empowered when invited to assess the organization and provide input, making them feel more connected and motivated to work towards the company's purpose and goals.
2. Collective Insight Report: Participants receive an insight report that provides overall results as well as insights into specific departments and roles, enabling them to understand how their contributions impact the organization as a whole.
3. Easy Setup: Organizing a collective assessment is made simple, requiring only email addresses of participants to get started.
4. Tips and Recommendations: After completing an individual or team survey, employees receive personalized tips and recommendations to help improve areas where the organization scored lowest.
5. Ongoing Growth: By reassessing periodically, organizations can track their progress and receive new recommendations for continuous improvement.
6. Sense of Progress: Regular assessments keep employees informed about the organization's progress, helping to maintain motivation and drive toward achieving conscious brand growth.
7. Access to Resources: Participating employees gain access to a wealth of information and resources related to conscious branding and business development.
8. Aligned Communications: Companies that adopt a conscious branding approach often see highly effective communications that align with their purpose and focus on positive, intrinsic values. This not only helps build brand trust but also simplifies promotion efforts.
9. Employee Engagement: Conscious leaders recognize the importance of intrinsic motivators in driving employee engagement, leading to a more fulfilling and meaningful work environment.
10. Community Building: By fostering a strong sense of community within the organization, conscious leaders encourage collaboration, open communication, and shared responsibility for the company's success.

As a society our value system is changing Education levels have risen and global awareness of life options and possibilities has soared We are becoming a much more conscious society we are shifting from materialistic influences to others-centred influences and our expectations of business have changed This shift in business values is described in a Fast Company article published in April   ‘The social contract that applies to capitalism has been rewritten Creating value for Shareholders at the expense of everything else will seem radically out of touch Creating value for the world now seems the only viable things to do This is going to force investors leaders and product marketing and operations teams to reconsider what they do and how they do it and how they can be part of the epic reconstruction or risk being irrelevant’  Conscious Brands bare their soul They dare to dream how the world could be There is an element of modern life that matters to them and that they want to change They

Purpose on purpose™ is powerful It transforms your company your culture and more importantly ensures your organisation pursues meaningful impact in the world  If your ‘why’ lacks clarity resonance and actionability or if you are still measuring your brand health and value exclusively with KPI’s profit margin or customer satisfaction there is every chance your organisation is being held back from contributing to a better future and reaching its own potential   In a  global survey of more than 30 consumers across 35 countries Accenture Strategy found that customers are no longer making decisions based solely on product selection or price; they’re assessing what a brand says what it does and what it stands for They support brands whose purpose aligns with their values and beliefs  Intentionally activating purpose connects unifies and mobilises people around a common goal which is the foundation for creating real change within your organisation industry and the world This requires an

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: In the given context, the mutual objective and outcome expected from collaborations involve achieving sustainability while fostering a strong cultural foundation within organizations. By working together and considering all aspects of economic, human, and natural capital, stakeholders aim to create long-term, environmentally friendly, and socially responsible practices. This collaboration leads to increased efficiency, reduced waste, enhanced employee engagement, and stronger relationships with communities. Ultimately, the shared goal is to drive business growth while promoting a healthier planet and vibrant cultures.

a business leader the tool enables you to invite your entire team to assess your organisation and receive a collective insight report Receive overall results as well as insights into departments and roles When employees are empowered to contribute and be heard they feel more connected and motivated to work towards your purpose and growth together  Setting up a collective assessment is easy All you need is the email addresses of those you wish to participate It could be a department a team or your entire workforce Click the link below to get started  Receive recommendations based on your results to empower your journey towards conscious growth  We’ve partnered with experts in the fields of human behaviour change management communications customer experience and leadership to develop recommendations for growth across each of the key areas Once an individual or team survey has been completed you will receive tips and recommendations to improve the area in which your organisation scored

for growth across each of the key areas Once an individual or team survey has been completed you will receive tips and recommendations to improve the area in which your organisation scored lowest  Re-assess to track company progress over time and receive new recommendations to enable ongoing growth  A sense of progress keeps us humans motivated and on track Come back after you’ve implemented changes and see where your organisation has improved The goal is for your organization to become more self-aware employees more engaged in the journey customers more committed and you see conscious brand growth  Return as many times as you like All of your assessment results will be stored on your profile   Keep updated with the latest news around the world on conscious branding and business Stay in the know as we release new tools insights and data
